content.description: Start in hueco make big move out to the rail and another to the top
Get in a mantle position on the huge rail. Hand foot match the rail with the left foot and palm up the sideways rails.
content.location: walk for about 40 sec to the left of glory hole GPS: 32.349220, -111.164725 Map

content.description: Slopers in Tucson? Start in the slot and on a sloper and climb straight up through slopers and pockets. Perch like a gargoyle on top for extra style points
content.location: Walk on the trail a little passed the point perpendicular to the house boulder. It is the first climbable boulder close to the trail. If you find a slabby small boulder close to the trail you have gone too far. 32.350837, -111.164860 ​Map​​​

content.description: Epic Choss Line. Same start as glory hole. follow jugs to huge undercling and ponder the next couple moves into the harder section. High point is the last pocket, after it gets real thin till a hueco jug at the top.
content.location: same start as glory hole but goes right Map

content.description: Start to the right of red Velvet on a 3 finger slimper and a lower sloper. Slap out left to another sloper and make your way up
Climb jugs and sloping arete to big bloc
content.location: On the back right side of the House boulder (southwest side)

content.description: Start on a left hand undercling and right hand crimp. One-Move-Wonder off the ground to the namesake hueco. Move on up to the rail and out left to an undercling to a smack to the lip. Top out and throw some gang gestures. (straight up has not been done due to choss flake).
content.location: on the very left side of the House Boulder in the cave 32.349282, -111.165241 Map

content.description: start on the right had dish and try to find the hidden high left hand crimp.  grad the first good side pull on the arete and toss up to the hueco. Mind the choss.
content.location: to the left of red velvet on the arete

content.description:
This area has a reasonable hike to a few solid rhyolite lines, and one beautiful hueco. The north facing peaks provide morning shade. Many of the climbs are north facing as well, providing all day shade in the winter. Be wary of cave hermits.

 This is state land that requires a pass which can be obtained here land.az.gov/natural-resourc…
